body.p:
456
March 14th 5
Col. Chas D. Pennebaker
State Agent
Washington D. C
Colonel.

I have the honor to request that you have copied for this Dept the original muster in rol of Maj Barnes battalion 16th Ky Cavl They were mustered in by Lt McIver at Paducah Ky without the consent of the Governor, as they were intended to fill the depleted ranks of the 12th Ky Cavl were without proper authority mustered as 10th. The War Dept as soon as notified of the facts revoked the muster and ordered their consolidation with the 12th But in the mean time one battalion had been Engaged in several Engagements and lost a number of their men. And in consideration of this fact the Governor requested that Lt McIvers muster be accepted, changing it however from the 16th to the 12th,
457
which was acceded to, as per letter of Maj Vincent to Maj Sidell dated July 1s 1864. These men are now with the 12th Cavl and known as companies "I" "K" "L" & "M".
I deem the above explanation necessary to enable you to get the proper rolls.
In addition to the rolls you have already furnished, I desire that you furnish the following copies. viz

"Rolls of the 16th Ky Infty in full ✓
✓ Field & Staff and Co "K" 17th Ky Infty.
✓ Rolls of the 19th 20th and 21s Infty in full.
✓ Rolls of the 25th Ky Infty in full.
✓ Rolls of the 28th " " " "
Field & Staff of the 30th Ky Infty.
✓ Roll of Co "G" 34th Ky Infty.
Field & Staff and Co "B" of the 35th Infty.
Field & Staff of the 37th, 39th, 40th, 45th, and 47th Infty.
Field & Staff of the 49th Infty.
Field & Staff of the 52d, and Co "I"
✓ Field & Staff of the 2d Ky Cavl.
✓ Field & Staff of the 3d Ky Cavl and of Co "M"
✓ Rolls of Companies "I" & "K" of the 4th cavl
✓ Rolls of Companies "A" & "K" of the 5th Cavl
458
✓ Rolls of companies "L" & "M" of the 7th Cavl
✓ Roll of company "L" of the 8th Cavl
Roll of company "M" of the 10th Cavl
Rolls of companies "G" "H" "I" K" "L" & M of the 11th Cavl
✓ Roll of the 1s Ky Independent Battery; This battery was originally Co "E" of the 1s Ky Infty and detached as artillery:
Roll of the 1s Ky Battery (Stones)
The above rolls are of great importance to the interests of our soldiers, and reference to them are daily requested
Please send forward the rolls as speedily as possible.

Very Respectfully
D W Lindsey
Adj Genl Ky
